Reviews.Title: “NH Hotel Aeropuerto T2 Mexico City...a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: YVRSweetheart
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel from March 6-10, 2012 on business. The hotel was clean and very modern. The room had hardwood floors throughout and included all the amenities that I wanted: from a large flat screen, wireless and wired internet, a minibar, iron and ironing board, hair dryer and clock radio with an Ipod connection. I don't speak very much Spanish, but the hotel staff spoke English and they were very friendly. The staff were always available and eager to help. I was very concerned with safety and I felt extremely safe in this hotel. The room included a safe large enough for all of my valuables, including my laptop, which was very appreciated. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were not as firm as I am used to, so this may be an issue for some people. I also appreciated that the TV included English channels, so I could get the news and some entertainment in English without having to focus solely on the internet. I also liked that the shower had a "telephone" showerhead so that I could avoid having the water in my face, since I was concerned about drinking the Mexican tap water and getting sick. I thought that the A/C was a bit noisy, but it was efficient and I started to get used to it after a few days there. I did not use the pool, but I had colleagues who did and they said it was great, although it was a bit cold. The restaurant also offered a breakfast buffet that could be included in the daily rate at a discount: $17.00 dollars/day added to your bill in advance vs. $25.00/day "pay as you go". Although I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, I saw a lot of people doing so and the food looked and smelled good to me. The hotel bar was very nice and offers a outside patio complete with potted palm trees. I saw a lot of airline staff from various airlines using this hotel, so that is always a good sign that it is clean, safe and well run. In terms of cost, I paid $6,636.00 Mexican Pesos for 4 nights, which works out to $129.40 Canadian Dollars/night, an excellent deal in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “You’re probably not coming back anyway, and they couldn’t care less if you don’t...”
Reviews.Author: Michael424
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay in this hideously expensive, if brand-new, hotel might be the convenience of an elevator ride from the heart of Terminal 2, but the Camino Real or Hilton may have been just as handy and have provided a better experience after a long and tiring flight. Of course the rooms are nicely equipped, large, super-modern, super-quiet and clean (though we had a drainy smell in the high-tec bathroom) but why do these soulless places make no effort whatsoever to provide a welcome or any of the basics you’d find in any backpacker hotel? Like, for example, a bottle or two of free water (only available in the minibar which you have to activate when registering); or free wi-fi (at an outrageous US$20), again pre-purchase-only. Even the coffee for the coffee-machine is safely locked up in the fridge! And we were unable to charge dinner in the restaurant to the room, but had to pay there and then. This lack of service mentality or respect for their guests extends to the bored, uninterested, totally unengaged and glacially slow reception staff, as so many others have commented. We were just abandoned when a ten-person flight crew arrived (after us) to check in. It is, by any standards, a disgrace to the NH name; all the problems reflect lack of management, particularly the check-in. Isn’t it obvious that tired airport travellers will just want a smile, and to get to their rooms quickly?

Reviews.Title: “Grading on a curve”
Reviews.Author: puertofanNyc
Reviews.Content: For an airport hotel, this hotel is 4 stars--especially for the Mexico City airport (the Camino Real is old, dingy and depressing!). This hotel is clean, modern and architecturally pleasing. We were able to take advantage of an online deal for $150 USD including taxes and breakfast for 2. (Their breakfast buffet is $22 USD/person.) As other reviews note, the check-in process is wonky and, in our case, they did not want to honor the complimentary breakfast. They even showed us that in their system the rez did not include breakfast despite the printed email we presented showing that breakfast was included. After much discussion, they did honor the deal. The other thing to note is that everything is a la carte at an additional fee (wifi and even coffee in your room is an extra fee). But, all in all, a very convenient and pleasant place to stay if you're in Terminal 2.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport location, dodgy wifi”
Reviews.Author: MrPinrel
Reviews.Content: this is a good choice if you have a morning flight from the airport and want to avoid traffic. very good breakfast. wifi service expensive and very poor, disconnects all the time and need to keep re logging in.

Reviews.Title: “Okay rooms, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: CMillerCaribbean
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and had to overnight to make flight connections. The hotel is nice for an aiport hotel but the staff is not as friendly what you customarily see in Mexico and also check it does take a long time. We also were first given a smoking room which was acceptable for us and our children. The second room we were given had not been cleaned when we walked in and had to wait for them to clean it. Then in the middle of the night, we heard the door rattling and someone was trying to use their key as it appeared that they have given our room out to another arriving guest! Overall, would stay somewhere else based on price which was expensive for the value, service and issues we had with our room.

Reviews.Title: “More time to check in than hours of sleep!”
Reviews.Author: NoSoyDeAquiNiSoyDeA
Reviews.Content: Everytime I have arrived at this hotel the line for checkin resembles that of an amusement ride during a holiday. You can spend up to an hour just to check in. When I arrived, they did not have my reservation on the system. My wake-up call was 50 min. early. (Add that to my one hour wait to get a room and that is now 2 hours of less sleep). I had breakfast in my room. Portions were extremely small, and the coffee was awful. I needed a bellboy in my room which I scheduled an hour earlier only to meet him half way to the lobby while I was dragging my bags. Last awful problem was that the room and the bathroom share a crystal wall. If you pee at night expect to wake up your partner when you turn on the bathroom lights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel but my bad luck .....”
Reviews.Author: HernanCortez
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within the T2 terminal, good accommodation and nice, varied breakfast should add up to a good stay. Unfortunately, in spite of the above and the friendly staff, my stay was one problem after another. Firstly, I waited a long time to be checked in. It wasn't that there were that many people waiting, they just seemed to have a problem with how they dealt with check ins, something that should be relatively straight forward. I get to the room and the key doesn't work. I go back and wait again. I'm eventually given a new key. It doesn't work either. This time I go straight to the counter and push in. On the third try, the key works (until I tried to get back in my room in the morning ... but that's another story) I get in the room tired after a long trip and the to'ing and fro'ing to the check in counter. I get ready to have a nice shower and just as I'm about to turn the water on, I notice ..... no towels ! So I have to call for towels to be brought to the room. No towels after 15 minutes, so I call again. Eventually I get my towels and can have a shower. Nice and relaxed, I sit on the bed and turn the TV on ..... you guessed it. The TV didn't work ! I expect my experience was just one of those days when everything went wrong. I'd stay here again as the location right inside the terminal can't be beaten if you have an early morning departure from T2 .... and I surely couldn't have a repeat of my previous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you have an early flight on T2”
Reviews.Author: El_Josu
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at the NH on T2 in Mexico City's Airport on our way back from Cancun. This hotel is HUGE and rooms are nicely appointed. There's a very Zen-like atmosphere to the hotel and it's right by the ticketing counters. The hotel is very convenient; the beds are VERY comfortable. The hotel is very modern, and it might not suit all tastes, but for an overnight hotel in T2 it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for quick stays”
Reviews.Author: izarauz
Reviews.Content: Business hotel, located at the airport. Splendid breakfast, nice rooms, and iverall nice stay. Could improve the wifi, I was in my room and there were places it was unavailable, have to get out of the room to re-connect

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Mexico City'a airport”
Reviews.Author: Aventurero2010
Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient for an overnight, totally useless for a stay in MÃ©xico. Rooms are good, front desk is perfectly useless; you can spend 20 minutes trying to get a warm body to answer. WIFI is shamelessly expensive. The coffee machine requires coffee loked away in the minifridge. Restaurant is standard but expensive. All of this why? Because they ca.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient, very modern.”
Reviews.Author: nielseng
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay when you need a overnight stay but less than 24 hours in Mexico City. There are many fast food places in the terminal if the hotel restaurant is not what you want. The gym is well equipped and clean. The room was clean and modern. The bathroom had high end faucets and facilities. The bed was a little more firm than I like but still comfortable. When checking in we were then only ones standing in line and the front desk seemed to be irritated that they had to stop what they were doing to check us in. They were not rude just uninterested. I felt like I was bothering them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but really far away from the town”
Reviews.Author: thedreamerMontevideo
Reviews.Content: the swimming pool was not finished or under maintenance. Mexico is a really hot place, so you need it! The hotel is inside T2, so there are no nice places near there...Just some fast food places in the terminal. There is not any noise of the airport, so don't worry about it! Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport terminals”
Reviews.Author: Karl R
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel convenient to terminals 1 and 2 at MEX. Fast check-in and courteous service. Big rooms with large bathrooms. Could use a desk for work. They've got two very uncomfortable chairs by a low table as their office set up. Not a single picture hanging on any wall; could use some decoration in these modern rooms. Also, the lighting consists of recessed flood lights everywhere. How about a night stand table lamp?

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for overnight stop in Benito Juarez Airport”
Reviews.Author: MilanoIsola
Reviews.Content: Despite the various opinions reported in this forum on Nh T2 hotel, I have to stick on the good ones. I found a very convenient location (exactly inside Terminal 2, the most recent one) and a carefull service. The building is brand new, rooms are large, very clean and stylish, with clear and relaxing colours. The ambience is calm and quiet. Extra services are good (I tried breakfast and in room dining), internet connection was OK. As only remark, pay attention that every extra is priced, even the print out of the boarding card.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel worth staying in at Mexico City airport.”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is inTerminal 2 so is not very convenient for international travellers although it is much MUCH better than either of the other two hotels at the airport (Hilton or Camino Real) that I think that it is well worth the 5 minute ride on the shuttle train (for which you will need a boarding pass or ticket, but they will accept one from the flight that you arrived on) or you can just get a taxi. Checkin is friendly and swift and the rooms are huge, cheerful and airy and the shower has fantastic pressure. Room service was swift and good and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob123235
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2011 while doing business in Mexico. I was surprised as the rooms were nice and clean and you would never know that you were in an airport. It was one of the best airport hotels I have stayed at. The meals were ok and service was not bad. It was a little slow at check in, but that happens at alot of hotels. The hotel itself was very convenient and unique design is impressive. I will stay here every time I visit Mexico City and need to stay at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for wake up and travel”
Reviews.Author: OctavioMexico
Reviews.Content: Good location especially if you donÂ´t wish to wakeup early and be in a hurry to arrive at the airport. The staff is friendly. Quiet and confortable rooms. Big beds, the room has all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “So trendy and spacious”
Reviews.Author: NessyBear
Reviews.Content: The NH Hotel at Mexico City T2 airport terminal is awesome. The hotel has a magnificent architecture (large and lots of space) and the rooms are very nice, so modern and yet so simple. The staff is friendly and they try to be as helpful as possible. I didn't see any restaurants (didn't ask either) but you have a wide variety of fast food joints at the terminal. You have access to the internet via the 2 computers at the lobby while enjoying complimentary tea, coffee and biscuits. Down side are the transfers to T1 if your flight leaves before 9am, you ned to pay a taxi as the shuttle or the monorail are not in service before that time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: lourdesharo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on August 17th with my son because we lost a flight and it was late. This hotel is nice but way overpriced. They charged us $280 and the hotel was empty -- they said it was all they had... They surcharge for everything bottled water and internet access in the rooms ($25 for 24 hrs that doesn't even work in the airport despite the hotel being in the airport). Great soundproofed windows but not the walls, you can hear your neighbors. No amount of nice wallpaper can hide this downside. I found very little value in what I spent to stay the night there. Head to the Marriott Courtyard across the street for similar amenities and a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “45 minutes waiting to check-in: how can this happen ?”
Reviews.Author: MaBoyOmar
Reviews.Content: Short stay, short review: we stayed there one night while transiting to Ixtapa. The check-in time was unbearable, the recption was clearly understaffed and the queue to check in was jut not moving fast enough. The room however was very nice, big, well equiped, good bathroom, nothing to reproach. Too bad It was so expensive and with a bad checkin process.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic that they should Charge Overpice for WiFI”
Reviews.Author: jriverog
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a lay over and were extremely displeassed that the 200 + USD dollar room did not even include wifi. Not only that but they charge 20 USD per day for wifi access!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a layover”
Reviews.Author: Supertalya
Reviews.Content: My flight from the US came in a 11:30pm and my flight the next day left at 6am. I was really worried about booking hotels away from the airport and found this gem after searching. It is literally inside the airport. The staff was friendly. I can't comment on any of the facilities since I only had a few hours in the hotel and everything was closed due to the late an early hour. It was pricey for Mexican standards but the convenience was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Layover Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globalflyereal
Reviews.Content: I had some concerns booking this hotel after reading some reviews however I am glad that I booked this hotel! I have an 8:00pm arrival and departure the next morning at 9:45am. The hotel is very modern with large and comfortable rooms. It was very quiet and the service was good. I would absolutely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ruffwriter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and sleek and attractive enough but they have serious service issues. 1) They could not find my reservation, and when checkin in at midnight this is worrisome. Granted, I had just made the reservation that day through Orbitz so I'll cut them some slack there. 2) However I had requested a no-smoking room and was put in a smoking room. They said it was the only room they had which I find hard to believe. But they didn't have the courtesy to explain that while I was checking in, leaving it to me to discover when I got to the room. 3) They had no mini bar key -- I requested one three times and they kept saying they would bring it up, but there obviously is only one master key and that either could not be located right away or they were short-staffed. Finally got it at 1 am. And because it is a master key and the door locks when you shut it we had to leave it ajar which flooded the room with light until we finally gave up and closed/locked it. 4) coffee is locked in the mini bar -- and there is no electrical outlet where coffee maker is located, meaning you have to move it. 5) Internet is not free and you can't long on from your room if you did want to pay for it. 6) ordered room service only to be brought the wrong order... twice. 7) If you are tall -- like over 5'8" you won't like the shower. Overall value for money: Low, but it is doubtful they care since there is no other hotel competition in Terminal 2.

Reviews.Title: “A safe and secure place to conduct business in Mexico City!”
Reviews.Author: RCRDSR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the airport and I literally took the elevator upstairs to the lobby after clearing customs in the airport. They provided me with a conference room in the business center and I conducted my business meetings there. There were a number of decent restaurants and fast food chains in the airport complex which offered variety. The hotel restaurants were very good. The hotel decor is very new age and made for the perfect upscale place to conduct business while in Mexico. The ability to conduct business safely and securely while traveling to clients was very important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Isaac_10
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling to other destination and you need to spend hours at Mexico City airport to catch your next flight, is better to get a room. NH is inside of T2 Mexico City airport, is new (2009 I think), the price is very rasonable, the furniture is modern, the service at the front Desk and rooms is excellent. The bedroom is clean with wireless access (not free), flat screen and comfortable matress. The bathroom is clean and new.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job but slow to check in/out”
Reviews.Author: Gray_Cancun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new and is still in good shape, too expensive for what it is, however the low maintenance is starting to show as with the rest of NH properties. The ckeck in and out is ridiculously slow, particularly if you need a printed invoice or a tax Factura, considering that is an airport hotel you need to allow time to wait, too few front desk staff and clumsy system, big downside. They have a small Gym with running machine directly against a glass wall, so be careful if you are planning to use it. Overall is just OK, will recommend it because you don't have any other options on that terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageously overpriced. Never again!”
Reviews.Author: carlYYC
Reviews.Content: As I work in the travel industry, I will NEVER RECOMMEND this hotel property. Outrageously overpriced, rude staff, and even have the nerve to charge additionally for morning coffee in your room and use of internet. I've already cancelled every customer that I had booked for the next 3 months. You can stay in a nice hotel downtown and near everything including taxi to/from the airport for far less!!! Never again! A total rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Hilton - Don't Expect Much Service”
Reviews.Author: CBerry80
Reviews.Content: When dealing with inconvenient layovers in MEX or unexpected travel surprises (like delays and cancelations), hotels inside the terminal can be a real savior. Mexico city int'l has 3 such hotels: The Camino Real, the Hilton and the NH. The Hilton has great service but the hotel is in serious need of a renovation and I've had a number of run ins with Bed Bugs theres which has forced me to steer clear. I haven't stayed at the Camino, but friends have said that for the price it is very tired and in need of a face-lift and some deep cleaning. This leaves the NH in terminal 2. My summary: The NH is new, clean and the rooms are very comfortable. The service is extremely poor. I had to wait from 9:30PM until 10:15PM in to check in. It would be one thing if the lines were long, but there were only 3 people in front of me. The amount of time it took to get people checked in was baffling. Suffice to say those of us waiting were tired and less than pleased. The room service was similar - the staff at the front desk informed me that they would have timely room service in them morning as the restaurant did not open until 6AM (IE when everyone's early flights leave). I put in my request for an early coffee and breakfast. When it did not arrive the next morning on time, I figured they'd just be a bit late. A few minutes before I left the room to make my flight, I got a call asking if I still wanted the room service I'd ordered. I kindly stated no and took the time to have it removed from my bill. No one was rude and the rooms again, were very clean and comfortable. I guess I was just disappointed that such a decent operation had such poor service. I will stay at the NH again as the rooms are by far the nicest. I will not however plan on expecting any decent service from the staff any time soon. If the Hilton ever gets renovated and they can get the biting bugs under control, then I'll be back there in a heartbeat. They have great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for morning flight, but...”
Reviews.Author: ArieLu
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel on the way back from Huatulco to Italy because we arrived at Ciudad de Mexico at 8 p.m. and we had a flight at 10 a.m. on the next morning. At final out flight was cancelled and we stayed there for 2 nights, so I could comment a bit more deeply. The hotel is new and modern and it is very nice. It is a big hotel (287 rooms) with a perfect noise isolation, so very good quality sleep. Room are modern and very clean. It is a bit pricy but it is perfect to stay onenight before taking a flight. The problem is the service, very far from professional and good level. The swimming pool, on every advertising of the hotel are closed. Breakfast is until 12 but on our first day at 11.20 it was closed because they had a lunch... Business center close at 9 p.m.and open at 9 a.m., not so udeful for a hotel where often people stay for one night. You have to pay for everything even it is yet pricy. They charge you for internet connection (in Mexico always it is free), for coffee maker in the room, for bottle of water (always complimentary). They blocked 180 euros on my credit card as a grant for minibar etcetera and they didn't gave me minibar key (yes, it has a key...) As a resume I say it is very good for one night because you can find a very good and quite room, but don't expect a high level service. I don't recommend their restaurant, go down on arrival level and have a wonderful dinner at "La Mansion"!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for early flight from T2 : superior to Camino Real and Fiesta Americana. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: josisteinfeld
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. Having read the bad reviews on this site I was dreading staying here but since we had an early flight from Terminal 2 we didn't want to waste 20 mins getting there from the other hotels. I cannot understand the bad reviews. The hotel is lovely, check-in staff were charming, the room was large, clean, and modern, the beds were very comfortable. Good bathroom. Good working air-conditioning. Lovely open-air pool and 24hr gym. We arrived mid- evening and had eaten on the plane and had an early morning flight so we didn't need the restaurant so I can't comment on the food. The checkout was speedy and efficient, and complimentary coffee in the lobby was available. The Camino Real is horrible - rooms are tired and drab in comparison, and staff charge huge corkage if you want to open your own bottle of wine. The pool is pathetic and indoors, which is awful on a lovely day. I would not stay there again unless I had very early T1 flight. The Fiesta Americana is offsite with outdoor pool and decent restaurant with decent rooms and I would rather stay there than Camino Real if leaving at a reasonable hour from Terminal 1.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but with some problems”
Reviews.Author: Pysiu
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed in this hotel was because I had an early layover the following day. Hotel is inside the airport, thus, super convienient. It is new an nicely decorated in a modern, cool style. Rooms are large and spacey with trendy decor. Bathroom was big with a huge shower. Those were the nice things. The bad things: no Internet in the room, sheets had holes in it, front desk wasn't very responsive, check out line super long and super slow, they didn't have an adaptor for my European cord, you would think hotel at the airport should expect international travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: justin1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night stopover to Acapulco. After I checked in I noticed that there was no hot water so I had to wash my face etc with cold water. The room by the way smelled like a toilet cleaner which I think is an NH Hotels standard smell as I've stayed in their hotel in Barcelona. When I woke up there was no hot water I just just packed up and check out. When I spoke to the manager about this he said he would look into it. After many calls and emails to the general manager, I got an apology but no rate reduction. Wouldn't you think the proper thing to do is to discount the room if a basic service was not provided? I highly recommend you stay at another hotel. This is a very poorly run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Jet Lag, Long Layovers or Early AM flight”
Reviews.Author: Dave9988
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Mexico City Airport...exhausted, sleep deprived and quite weak. With a 6 hour layover, I needed to rest. Went to the NH lobby, saw their rack rate of 180 USD and immediatley went to the computer in thier lobby. On their website, I found a rate of 99 USD..Booked it and after a quick check in, went to my well appointed, spacious room with two large beds, a huge bathroom and great furniture. I slept in their comfortable beds a good 4.5 hours - fully recharged and still had plenty of time to make my domestic connection in T2 (after taking the train shuttle). I did not have to check in luggage, so you would need more time if you have to check in luggage.....I never did use any of the hotel's other amenities...however, for someone tired at the airport and in need a place to recover from jet lag or with a very long layover or an early am flight, I highly recommend this safe and very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: Curb88
Reviews.Content: $165/night with no internet, no coffee, no bottled water, low quality bedding, no washcloth, 1 bar of soap to share between shower and sink, poor tv reception, slow check in, slow check out and no one answers the phone when you call for assistance. Convenient for T2 travelers, but that's all. For 1/2 the price you could stay at the Ramada and get better services.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: andrew10412
Reviews.Content: Just checked out this morning after 5th trip there. Time after time I have tried to give them another chance, but this hotel is the pits; especially for business travelers. *ALWAYS an immense line at the front desk both check-in and check-out. due to these immense lines, if you need to call for anything they just won't pick up the phone, or quickly pickup/hangup. *restaurant is a joke and very slow. *rooms are clean, except the beds are disgusting. It wasn't until my second trip that I realize they only change the sheets and not the duvet around the comforter. since i noticed this every room i have stayed in has had marks and hairs all over the white duvet - gross. *staff are rude. they don't care and are S L O W *their rewards program isn't worth a damn *they often overbook and even if you prepay a room will downgrade you to another and make you pay the same price without telling you. for that reason the past 4 trips i have made sure to ask 'what type of room is this' before telling them what i reserved. today was the final straw. the hilton in T1 may be old and in need of a revamp, but at least they have standards and understand the meaning of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel ripped me off”
Reviews.Author: Josie73
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, right at the airport. Yes, the bed and room were comfortable. However... When I checked in they made me sign my Amex receipt. The next morning, as I was checking out, they presented me with another AMEX receipt. I told them that I already signed one. They said "oh no problema senor, you must sign again on check out" I was already late for an early flight, so I just signed. Bad Move. My Amex card got both charges on it, as well as a room charge for some other person. I disputed this with AMEX. They sent AMEX the receipts clearly showing identical charges for the same room number on the same night, as well as the charge for the other person, with a different name, room number etc but charged to MY AMEX card. They did this all with a smile...cowardly thieves.

Reviews.Title: “You would never know you are in an airport....."”
Reviews.Author: tip76
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews for the newly opened (Aug, 2009) NH Hotel in Terminal 2 of the Benito Juarez International Airport (Mexico City), I decided to swim against the current and give it a try. I had previously stayed at the Hilton hotel in Terminal 1 and found it to be noisy, smelly and old, like the other reviews for it I had seen on TripAdvisor. So, I booked my room for the week at the NH Hotel T2 and secured a junior suite for $190 a night (same price as Hilton's normal rooms). The suite consisted of 2 rooms, with beautiful hardwood floors, a living room, a bedroom, 1 full bathroom with shower AND bath and toilet and 1 other bathroom off the living room. In other words, there was PLENTY of space for me and my things. The king bed was very comfortable and the Euro-styling of the rooms is great - very minimalist design. For $190 a night, I found this room to be a great deal. And contrary to the previous reviews I saw on this hotel, the service was VERY good and everyone was extremely attentive to my requests and needs. I think that they have cleaned up their act in this area... To be balanced in this review - some downsides to mention were: 1) poorly lit gym (it is lit mostly by the natural skylight so if you go before the sun comes up, you can't see what you are doing very well 2) restaurant only offers "Americanized" food - I wanted to have some Mexican food in Mexico and the restaurant was very short on such offerings. 3) They have a mini-fridge in the room with drinks in it (a "mini-bar" of sorts) but it wasn't plugged in! I had to lift the heavy minifridge out of the cabinet, move it across the living room and plug it in! Further, when you take your key out of the Euro-style lighting activator when you leave for the day, the mini-fridge turns off beceause the power to the room is deactivated without the room key stuck in the "slot" by the door. 4) The coffee maker in the room was very plain and there was no sugar or milk to put in the coffee. I don't need much when I stay in a hotel and so if you are a self sufficient traveler who just wants a stylish, clean, tidy and spacious room to stay in, then I fully recommend this hotel vs. the Hilton. I am not going to compare this hotel to other hotels IN Mexico City, as that is not fair. I am only comparing this hotel to the Hilton in T1 of the airport as that is apples to apples comparison. NH Hotel is the CLEAR winner in this battle.

Reviews.Title: “I will avoid if possible in the future...”
Reviews.Author: golfing10
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel via Mexico City connecting to other destinations. This time I had a reservation for an early conecting flight the following day so decided to try NH. Have stayed in Camino Real, Hilton T1 and Fiesta Inn so wanted to see the NH. Flew in from Veracruz in the evening. Reception had me marked as a no show to start off. Bellboys eager to assist even though I only had roller carry on and laptop case. did not need help. Check in was a little slow but they seemed friendly with repeat customers that were checking in. Given my room key and then went on a hike to find the room. Furthest room from reception on 2nd floor. Room new and fresh. Decided to connect to internet only to find irt was extra $200 per day!. Decided I could take a rest from internet for the night. Went to the bar - very dreary and only 3 other customers. Ate some food which was OK. Drinks highly priced. Lousy sleep but then I always find it hard to sleep in Mexico City due to the altitude. On way to check out several room service trays still left outside rooms. Overall impression, no atmosphere and you pay extra for everything. Will avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: HappyDanish
Reviews.Content: The NH hotel is situated in the Terminal 2 and therefore a good choice, if you need to take an early flight. It seems to be cheaper than other hotels in the area. The service is always professional and I always get help with my suitcases etc. They can remember you, when you come there often, which is really nice being a frequent traveller for business.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms...horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Slocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here late last year. Yes, its a new hotel - ie so brand new everything is spotlessly clean. I get that hotels sometimes have 'growning pains' upon opening - but this was months after opening. Upon arrival only one guest was ahead of us - despite this, it took 45 loooong minutes to check in. Before arrival and at check-in I asked for a smoking room - was assured the room was. Found the room by ourselves - no smoking signs in the room. Back to reception - now there are five people checking in - didn't want to be rude and interrupt their rather tedious checkin for others , so hung out at the bar with our bags until someone at check in was available...approx an hour later. I was then told, ignore the signs, "all our rooms are smoking"!!! Beware (it has nothing to do with the hotel) but the next AM we were schedules to leave T1 - the train between terminals breaks down constantly as it did that morning. One lonely shuttle bus was put into place - between the time finding the bus etc, it took us an hour to get between terminals. I have been thru MEX, many many times - stayed at the Hilton T1 numerous times and the Camino Real even more. Until they get their act together, I cannot recommend this hotel. Slocker

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: gt3rsbobby
Reviews.Content: I travel to Mexico City every two weeks, usually stay at Hilton in T1, but my flight was in/out of T2 this trip and thought I'd try something new. First let me explain that when in Mexico City the service in restaurants, hotels and whatever is always bar none. Wish the US was so consistent in customer service. But, that was until I stayed at the NH Hotel at Terminal 2 MEX airport. The rooms were new and nice. But the people are awful. I will never stay here again, nor recommend it to anyone. from the front desk, bellmen to room service it all sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not in international terminal”
Reviews.Author: FellowTaveler2
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, great service and very comfortable. However, it's in terminal T2, which is the domestic terminal so some of the convenience of being at the airport is lost. If you need the international terminal, you have to take the train. If you're getting in late in the day or leaving early, you need to take a taxi to get from one terminal to the other.
